H0.text: Used to describe US citizens who attempted to foment insurrections in Latin America in the mid-19th century, what is the term for someone who engages in an unauthorized military expedition into a foreign country to support a revolution. Mercenary

H1.text: Used to describe US citizens who attempted to foment insurrections in Latin America in the mid-19th century, what is the term for someone who engages in an unauthorized military expedition into a foreign country to support a revolution. Insurgent

H2.text: Used to describe US citizens who attempted to foment insurrections in Latin America in the mid-19th century, what is the term for someone who engages in an unauthorized military expedition into a foreign country to support a revolution. Adventurer

H3.text: Used to describe US citizens who attempted to foment insurrections in Latin America in the mid-19th century, what is the term for someone who engages in an unauthorized military expedition into a foreign country to support a revolution. Filabuster

A4.text: The modern English form 'filibuster' was borrowed in the early 1850s from the Spanish filibustero (lawless plunderer).

A5.text: The term was applied to adventurers like William Walker who were engaging in private military expeditions in Latin America.
